algorithm_technique: Sorting, combinatorics, and greedy approach to count subsequence contributions
Sorting, combinatorics, and greedy approach to count subsequence contributions
problem_summary_simple: Find the sum of min and max elements of all subsequences with at most k elements.
problem_summary_technical: Sort array, use combinatorics to count contributions of smallest/largest elements to subsequences.
key_insights: The problem can be solved by considering the contribution of each element as a minimum or maximum.
Sorting the array allows us to easily pick the smallest and largest elements.
Combinatorics (nCr) is used to count how many subsequences of size at most k an element participates in as min/max.
